ai-tha-ap25:0.3_0: He enjoyed himself with fear and terror;
ai-tha-ap25:1.1_0: Seeing the moon in the waning fortnight,
ai-tha-ap25:1.3_0: My mother was blind, my father,

ai-tha-ap25:5.4_0: I’ve gone to a bad place.

ai-tha-ap25:7.4_0: full of saliva, tears, feces, and pus.

ai-tha-ap25:9.1_0: peaceful, in the heaven of the gods,

ai-tha-ap25:10.1_0: I pay homage to the west,
ai-tha-ap25:12.2_0: acting as ruler of the gods.
ai-tha-ap25:15.4_0: they brought me to the Saṅgha.

ai-tha-ap25:18.3_0: the Buddha gave me the going forth,
ai-tha-ap25:18.4_0: The Seer of the best of men.
ai-tha-ap25:20.2_0: a wise one dispels the goal
ai-tha-ap25:20.4_0: I’ve attained the state of grace.
ai-tha-ap25:21.1_0: Those who have nothing left over
ai-tha-ap25:21.2_0: listen to me, hear my words.

ai-tha-ap25:23.4_0: see what is seen and heard.
ai-tha-ap25:24.4_0: you’ll make an end to suffering.
ai-tha-ap25:25.2_0: who come to their ethical conduct,

ai-tha-ap25:29.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable married girls.
